info.title: Docker Remote API
info.description: The Docker API is an HTTP REST API served by Docker Engine. It is the API the Docker client uses to communicate with the Engine, so everything the Docker client can do can be done with the API.

Hostname.description: The hostname to use for the container, as a valid RFC 1123 hostname

Domainname.description: The domain name to use for the container

Image.description: The name of the image to use when creating the container

Command.description: Command to run as a string or list of strings

BlkioWeight.description: Block IO weight (relative weight vs. other containers) (UNIX only)

CpuShares.description: CPU shares (relative weight vs. other containers)

CpuPeriod.description: CPU Completely Fair Scheduler period (UNIX only)

CpuQuota.description: CPU Completely Fair Scheduler quota (UNIX only)

ContainerListSummary.description: The representation of a container when listing them.

Command.description: Command to run when starting the container

Image.description: The name of the image used when creating this container

ImageID.description: The ID of the image that this container was created from

Labels.description: Labels that have been applied to this container

Names.description: The names that this container has been given

NetworkSettings.description: A summary of the container's network settings

Ports.description: The ports exposed by this container

SizeRootFs.description: The total size of all the files in this container

SizeRw.description: The size of files that have been created or changed by this container

Status.description: Additional human-readable status of this container (e.g. `Exit 0`)

EndpointSettings.description: EndpointSettings stores the network endpoint details

get.description: List containers

parameters.name: all
parameters.description: Return all containers. By default, only running containers are shown

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Return this number of most recently created containers, including non-running ones.

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: Return the size of container as fields `SizeRw` and `SizeRootFs`.

parameters.name: filters
parameters.description:
Filters to process on the container list, encoded as JSON (a map[string][]string). For example, `{"status": ["paused"]}` will only return paused containers.

Available filters:
 -   `exited=<int>` containers with exit code of  `<int>`
 - `status=`(`created`|`restarting`|`running`|`paused`|`exited`|`dead`)
 - `label=key` or `label="key=value"` of a container label
 - `isolation=`(`default`|`process`|`hyperv`) (Windows daemon only)
 - `ancestor`=(`<image-name>[:<tag>]`, `<image id>`, or `<image@digest>`)
 - `before`=(`<container id>` or `<container name>`)
 - `since`=(`<container id>` or `<container name>`)
 - `volume`=(`<volume name>` or `<mount point destination>`)
 - `network`=(`<network id>` or `<network name>`)

post.description: Create a container

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Assign the specified name to the container. Must match `/?[a-zA-Z0-9_-]+`.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: Container to create

get.description: Return low-level information about a container.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID or name of the container

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: Return the size of container as fields `SizeRw` and `SizeRootFs`

get.summary: List processes running inside a container
get.description: List processes running inside a container. On Unix systems, this is done by running the `ps` command. This endpoint is not supported on Windows.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID or name of the container

parameters.name: ps_args
parameters.description: The arguments to pass to `ps`. For example, `aux`

get.description:
Get stdout and stderr logs from a container.

Note: This endpoint works only for containers with the `json-file` or `journald` logging driver.

101.description: Logs returned as a stream. Hints proxies that the connection is being hijacked.

200.description: Logs returned as a string in response body.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID or name of the container

parameters.name: follow
parameters.description: Return the logs as a stream. This will return a `101` HTTP response with a `Connection: upgrade` header, then hijack the HTTP connection to send raw output.

parameters.name: stdout
parameters.description: Return logs from stdout

parameters.name: stderr
parameters.description: Return logs from stderr

parameters.name: since
parameters.description: Only return logs since this time, as a UNIX timestamp

parameters.name: timestamps
parameters.description: Add timestamps to every log line

parameters.name: tail
parameters.description: Only return this number of log lines from the end of the logs. Specify as an integer or `all` to output all log lines.

get.summary: Get changes on a containers filesystem
get.description:
Returns which files in a container's filesystem have been added, deleted, or modified. The `Kind` of modification can be one of:
 - `0`: Modified
 - `1`: Added
 - `2`: Deleted

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID or name of the container

get.description: Export the contents of a container as a tarball.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID or name of the container

get.summary: Get container stats based on resource usage
get.description:
This endpoint returns a live stream of a containers resource usage statistics.

The `precpu_stats` is the CPU statistic of last read, which is used for calculating the CPU usage percentage. It is not the same as the `cpu_stats` field.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID or name of the container

parameters.name: stream
parameters.description: Stream the output. If false, the stats will be output once and then it will disconnect.

post.description: Resize the TTY for a container. You must restart the container for the resize to take effect.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID or name of the container

parameters.name: h
parameters.description: Height of the tty session in characters

parameters.name: w
parameters.description: Width of the tty session in characters

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID or name of the container

parameters.name: detachKeys
parameters.description: Override the key sequence for detaching a container. Format is a single character `[a-Z]` or `ctrl-<value>` where `<value>` is one of: `a-z`, `@`, `^`, `[`, `,` or `_`.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID or name of the container

parameters.name: t
parameters.description: Number of seconds to wait before killing the container

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID or name of the container

parameters.name: t
parameters.description: Number of seconds to wait before killing the container

post.description: Send a POSIX signal to a container, defaulting to killing to the container.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID or name of the container

parameters.name: signal
parameters.description: Signal to send to the container as an integer or string (e.g. `SIGINT`)

post.description: Change various configuration options of a container without having to recreate it.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID or name of the container

parameters.name: update
parameters.description: Update config json

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID or name of the container

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: New name for the container

post.description: Pause the container id

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID or name of the container

post.description: Unpause the container id

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID or name of the container

post.description: Attach to the container id

101.description: no error, hints proxy about hijacking

200.description: no error, no upgrade header found

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID or name of the container

parameters.name: detachKeys
parameters.description: Override the key sequence for detaching a container. Format is a single character [a-Z] or ctrl-<value> where <value> is one of: a-z, @, ^, [, , or _.

parameters.name: logs
parameters.description: 1/True/true or 0/False/false, return logs. Default false

parameters.name: stream
parameters.description: 1/True/true or 0/False/false, return stream. Default false

parameters.name: stdin
parameters.description: 1/True/true or 0/False/false, if stream=true, attach to stdin. Default false.

parameters.name: stdout
parameters.description: 1/True/true or 0/False/false, if logs=true, return stdout log, if stream=true, attach to stdout. Default false.

parameters.name: stderr
parameters.description: 1/True/true or 0/False/false, if logs=true, return stderr log, if stream=true, attach to stderr. Default false.

get.description: Attach to the container id with a websocket.

101.description: no error, hints proxy about hijacking

200.description: no error, no upgrade header found

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID or name of the container

parameters.name: logs
parameters.description: 1/True/true or 0/False/false, return logs. Default false

parameters.name: stream
parameters.description: 1/True/true or 0/False/false, return stream. Default false

parameters.name: stdin
parameters.description: 1/True/true or 0/False/false, if stream=true, attach to stdin. Default false.

parameters.name: stdout
parameters.description: 1/True/true or 0/False/false, if logs=true, return stdout log, if stream=true, attach to stdout. Default false.

parameters.name: stderr
parameters.description: 1/True/true or 0/False/false, if logs=true, return stderr log, if stream=true, attach to stderr. Default false.

post.description: Block until container id stops, then returns the exit code

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID or name of the container

delete.description: Remove the container id from the filesystem

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID or name of the container

parameters.name: v
parameters.description: 1/True/true or 0/False/false, Remove the volumes associated to the container. Default false.

parameters.name: force
parameters.description: 1/True/true or 0/False/false, Kill then remove the container. Default false.

head.summary: Retrieving information about files and folders in a container
head.description: Get an tar archive of a resource in the filesystem of container

400.description: client error, bad parameter, details in JSON response body, one of: must specify path parameter (path cannot be empty) not a directory (path was asserted to be a directory but exists as a file)

404.description: client error, resource not found, one of: 1) no such container (container id does not exist) 2) no such file or directory (path resource does not exist)

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID or name of the container

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: Resource in the containers filesystem to archive.

get.summary: Get an archive of a filesystem resource in a container
get.description: Get an tar archive of a resource in the filesystem of container id.

400.description: client error, bad parameter, details in JSON response body, one of: must specify path parameter (path cannot be empty) not a directory (path was asserted to be a directory but exists as a file)

404.description: client error, resource not found, one of: 1) no such container (container id does not exist) 2) no such file or directory (path resource does not exist)

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID or name of the container

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: Resource in the containers filesystem to archive.

put.summary: Extract an archive of files or folders to a directory in a container
put.description: Upload a tar archive to be extracted to a path in the filesystem of container id.

403.description: Permission denied, the volume or container rootfs is marked as read-only.

404.description: No such container or path does not exist inside the container

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID or name of the container

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: Path to a directory in the container to extract the archives contents into.

parameters.name: noOverwriteDirNonDir
parameters.description: If 1, true, or True then it will be an error if unpacking the given content would cause an existing directory to be replaced with a non-directory and vice versa.

parameters.name: inputStream
parameters.description: The input stream must be a tar archive compressed with one of the following algorithms: identity (no compression), gzip, bzip2, xz.

get.description: List Images

parameters.name: all
parameters.description: Show all images. Only images from a final layer (no children) are shown by default.

parameters.name: filters
parameters.description: A JSON encoded value of the filters (a map[string][]string) to process on the containers list

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: Only return images with the specified name.

parameters.name: digests
parameters.description: Show digest information, default to false

post.summary: Build an image from Dockerfile via stdin
post.description: Build an image from Dockerfile via stdin

parameters.name: inputStream
parameters.description: The input stream must be a tar archive compressed with one of the following algorithms: identity (no compression), gzip, bzip2, xz.

parameters.name: dockerfile
parameters.description: Path within the build context to the Dockerfile. This is ignored if remote is specified and points to an individual filename.

parameters.name: t
parameters.description: A repository name (and optionally a tag) to apply to the resulting image in case of success.

parameters.name: remote
parameters.description: A Git repository URI or HTTP/HTTPS URI build source. If the URI specifies a filename, the files contents are placed into a file called Dockerfile.

parameters.name: q
parameters.description: Suppress verbose build output.

parameters.name: nocache
parameters.description: Do not use the cache when building the image.

parameters.name: pull
parameters.description: Attempt to pull the image even if an older image exists locally

parameters.name: rm
parameters.description: Remove intermediate containers after a successful build (default behavior).

parameters.name: forcerm
parameters.description: always remove intermediate containers (includes rm)

parameters.name: memory
parameters.description: Set memory limit for build.

parameters.name: memswap
parameters.description: Total memory (memory + swap), -1 to disable swap.

parameters.name: cpushares
parameters.description: CPU shares (relative weight).

parameters.name: cpusetcpus
parameters.description: CPUs in which to allow execution (e.g., 0-3, 0,1).

parameters.name: cpuperiod
parameters.description: The length of a CPU period in microseconds.

parameters.name: cpuquota
parameters.description: Microseconds of CPU time that the container can get in a CPU period.

parameters.name: buildargs
parameters.description: Total memory (memory + swap), -1 to disable swap.

parameters.name: Content-type
parameters.description: Set to 'application/tar'.

parameters.name: X-Registry-Auth
parameters.description: A base64-encoded AuthConfig object

post.description: Create an image either by pulling it from the registry or by importing it

parameters.name: fromImage
parameters.description: Name of the image to pull. The name may include a tag or digest. This parameter may only be used when pulling an image.

parameters.name: fromSrc
parameters.description: Source to import. The value may be a URL from which the image can be retrieved or - to read the image from the request body. This parameter may only be used when importing an image.

parameters.name: repo
parameters.description: Repository name given to an image when it is imported. The repo may include a tag. This parameter may only be used when importing an image.

parameters.name: tag
parameters.description: Tag or digest.

parameters.name: inputImage
parameters.description: Image content if the value - has been specified in fromSrc query parameter

parameters.name: X-Registry-Auth
parameters.description: A base64-encoded AuthConfig object

get.description: Return low-level information on the image name

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Image name or id

get.summary: Get the history of an image
get.description: Return the history of the image name

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Image name or id

post.description: Push the image name on the registry

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Image name or id

parameters.name: tag
parameters.description: The tag to associate with the image on the registry.

parameters.name: X-Registry-Auth
parameters.description: A base64-encoded AuthConfig object

parameters.name: repo

parameters.name: force

parameters.name: force
parameters.description: 1/True/true or 0/False/false, default false

parameters.name: noprune
parameters.description: 1/True/true or 0/False/false, default false.

parameters.name: authConfig

get.description: Display system-wide information.
Show the docker version information
Ping the docker server

post.summary: Create a new image from a containers changes
post.description: Create a new image from a containers changes

parameters.name: containerConfig
parameters.description: The container configuration

parameters.name: container
parameters.description: Container id or name to commit

parameters.name: repo

parameters.name: pause
parameters.description: 1/True/true or 0/False/false, whether to pause the container before committing

get.description: Get container events from docker, either in real time via streaming, or via polling (using since).

parameters.description: Timestamp used for polling

parameters.name: until
parameters.description: Timestamp used for polling

parameters.name: filters
parameters.description: A json encoded value of the filters (a map[string][]string) to process on the event list.

get.summary: Get a tarball containing all images in a repository

get.summary: Get a tarball containing all images.

parameters.name: imagesTarball
